title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown.
I Already check all the rails and the bad one i guess is PP5V S0.
PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V

The board is very clean, like a new.

Any hint from here?

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: U8080 seems like a good candidate. Check enable first though

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
U8080
Pin 2 = 3.33V after 0V

J7000 Pin 3:
PP5V_S4RS3 after 30 seconds 5V goes to 0V

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: So is there 5v on R8081? If not it seems like a dead U8080.

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: Yes, i get 5V on R8081, however, like i mentioned, after 30 seconds shutdown.

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: So what about this then? "PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V"

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
" The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown "
0 = shutdown

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: Could be anything. Any history on this thing?

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
Yes, liquid (milk) damage / wont turn on.
Around SMC looks fine. Actually the whole board looks fine.

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
" The board starts, however, after 30 seconds shutdown "
I still don't know if by "start" you mean it chimes and displays a picture. Was this thing touched before it got to you?

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
Chime and after 30s or less shuts down.
that's what happen since i start working on it

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message: and what about this: PP5V S0 - 4.0V and sometimes 3.9V ? This would cause shutdowns if 5V_S0 is not stable of course.

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
Yes, i know, that's why im here trying to figure out.
PP5V_S0 needs to be 5V, right? I don't get any 5V there. Always 4 or 3.9V

title: 820-006164 - pp5v s0 4.0v
message:
I will replace and i let you know.
Thank you for all your help, [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER]
